Perceptor:

"Neverl will exist a program that works like that"hissed Perceptor"I tried 
do it with Nightlight and Rodimus and both remembered the emotional bond 
among them... Rodimus fully remembered and Nighlight... well she still love 
him eventhoug she doesnt remember him fully... It seems that some emotions 
are hard to forget"

After few seconds he said"I tought that we will wipe out her corrupted 
programs not her memories"

-----Original Message----- 
From: Super Cyclonus
Sent: Thursday, November 04, 2010 10:09 AM
To: nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: The Awakening/nighlight

> <OLD>
>
> "We can ask the hamster to be our test subject"said PErceptor"After all 
> from
> a rato to a rat lab is a show trip; I have a teory: more time that one
> program is running would be harder to remove, it also depends of the
> Psicological state from the subject. When I reprogramed for firstime
> Nightlight it was very hard to do it but this second time, was relative
> easy. I think that the captivity was a factor to break her mind and her
> spirit... tell me when the program is done"

Bump nodded, his red armored head bobbing up and down as he worked. "I
am almost finished." he said, as he and Legacy's code scrolled across
the screen.

For those who knew how to read code, it was the most elegant that had
ever been written, but it is obvious that the two that were writing it
had great technical expertise. It looked as if the program were
designed to give the victim a total memory wipe down to the core.

The tall bulky form of Santon stood behind Perceptor, his arms behind
his back. "Tell me Perceptor." The Maximal doctor said as he watched
both the code and Perceptor, "We are busy writing a program that would
totally erase the memories of anyone if implanted properly and deeply
enough." Santon loked squarely at perceptor, "What could you do with a
program like that?" It would seem that Santon was testing Perceptor in
some way, to see what his thoughts were about the casual use of such a
potentially destrcutive program.

(TAG)

Preston
